==Events==
*[[1099]] &ndash; [[First Crusade]]: 15,000 starving [[Christianity|Christian]] soldiers march in a religious [[procession]] around [[Jerusalem]] as its [[Islam|Muslim]] defenders look on.
*[[1139]] &ndash; [[Song Dynasty]] general [[Yue Fei]] defeats an army led by [[Jin Dynasty (1115–1234)|Jin Dynasty]] general [[Wanyan Wuzhu]] at the [[Battle of Yancheng]] during the [[Jurchen campaigns against the Song Dynasty|Jin–Song wars]].
*[[1283]] &ndash; [[War of the Sicilian Vespers]]: [[Roger of Lauria]], commanding the [[Crown of Aragon|Aragonese]] fleet defeats an [[Capetian House of Anjou|Angevin]] fleet sent to put down a rebellion on [[Malta]] in the [[Battle of Malta]].
*[[1497]] &ndash; [[Vasco da Gama]] sets sail on the first direct European voyage to India.
*[[1579]] &ndash; [[Our Lady of Kazan]], a holy [[icon]] of the [[Russian Orthodox Church]], is discovered underground in the city of [[Kazan]], [[Tatarstan]].
*[[1663]] &ndash; [[Charles II of England]] grants [[John Clarke (Baptist minister)|John Clarke]] a [[Royal charter]] to [[Rhode Island]].
*[[1709]] &ndash; [[Great Northern War]]: [[Battle of Poltava]] &ndash; [[Peter the Great|Peter I of Russia]] defeats [[Charles XII of Sweden]] at [[Poltava]] thus effectively ending Sweden's role as a major power in Europe.
*[[1716]] &ndash; Great Northern War: the naval [[Battle of Dynekilen]] takes place.
*[[1730]] &ndash; An estimated [[1730 Valparaíso earthquake|magnitude 8.7 earthquake]] causes a [[tsunami]] that damages more than {{convert|1000|km|mi|abbr=on}} of Chile's coastline.
*[[1758]] &ndash; French forces hold [[Fort Carillon]] against the [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] at [[Ticonderoga, New York]].
*[[1760]] &ndash; [[French and Indian War]]: [[Battle of Restigouche]] &ndash; British forces defeat French forces in last naval battle in [[New France]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; The [[Olive Branch Petition]] is signed by the [[Continental Congress]] of the [[Thirteen Colonies]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; [[Joseph Bonaparte]] approves the [[Bayonne Statute]], a royal charter intended as the basis for his rule as king of Spain.
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Chippewas]] turn over a huge tract of land in [[Ontario]] to the United Kingdom.
*[[1853]] &ndash; U.S. Commodore [[Matthew_C._Perry|Matthew Perry]] arrives in Edo bay with a treaty requesting trade.
*[[1859]] &ndash; King [[Charles XV of Sweden|Charles XV & IV]] accedes to the throne of [[Union between Sweden and Norway|Sweden–Norway]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[Ikedaya Incident]]: the [[Chōshū Domain|Choshu Han]] [[Shishi (organization)|shishi]]'s planned [[Shinsengumi]] sabotage on [[Kyoto]], Japan at Ikedaya.
*[[1874]] &ndash; The [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police|Mounties]] begin their [[North-West Mounted Police|March West]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; [[White supremacy|White supremacists]] kill five Black Republicans in [[Hamburg, Aiken County, South Carolina|Hamburg, South Carolina]].
*[[1879]] &ndash; Sailing ship {{USS|Jeannette|1878|6}} departs San Francisco carrying an ill-fated expedition to the North Pole.
*[[1889]] &ndash; The first issue of ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' is published.
*[[1892]] &ndash; [[St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador|St. John's, Newfoundland, Canada]] is devastated in the [[Great Fire of 1892]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; The death of crime boss [[Soapy Smith]], killed in the [[Shootout on Juneau Wharf]], releases [[Skagway, Alaska]] from his iron grip.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Couceiro]] leads [[Royalist attack on Chaves|an unsuccessful royalist attack]] against the [[First Portuguese Republic]] in [[Chaves Municipality, Portugal|Chaves]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; The [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] reaches its lowest level of the [[Great Depression]], closing at 41.22.
*[[1933]] &ndash; The first [[rugby union]] [[Test match (rugby union)|test match]] between the [[Australia national rugby union team|Wallabies of Australia]] and the [[South Africa national rugby union team|Springboks of South Africa]] is played at [[Newlands Stadium]] in [[Cape Town]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan sign the [[Treaty of Saadabad]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; Reports are broadcast that a [[Unidentified flying object|UFO]] crash landed in [[Roswell, New Mexico]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[United States Air Force]] accepts its first female recruits into a program called [[Women in the Air Force]] (WAF).
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Francis Gary Powers]] is charged with [[espionage]] resulting from his flight over the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Ne Win]] besieges and dynamites the [[University of Yangon|Rangoon University]] Student Union building to crush the [[Student activism|Student Movement]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[List of Kings of Burundi|King]] [[Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng of Burundi|Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng]] of [[Burundi]] is deposed by his son Prince [[Ntare V of Burundi|Charles Ndizi]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[Dodge Revolutionary Union Movement|Chrysler wildcat strike]] begins in [[Detroit, Michigan]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Richard Nixon]] delivers a special congressional message enunciating [[Native American self-determination]] as official US Indian policy, leading to the [[Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; Assassination attempt against [[Iraq]]i president [[Saddam Hussein]] in [[Dujail]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Island Express (train)|Island Express]] train travelling from [[Bangalore]] to [[Kanyakumari]] [[Peruman railway accident|derails on the Peruman bridge]] and falls into [[Ashtamudi Lake]], killing 105 passengers and injuring over 200 more.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Kim Jong-il]] begins to assume [[List of leaders of North Korea|supreme leadership]] of [[North Korea]] upon the death of his father, [[Kim Il-sung]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Delta Goodrem]] diagnosed with [[Hodgkin's Lymphoma]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle Atlantis]] is launched in the [[STS-135|final mission]] of the U.S. [[Space Shuttle]] program.
